responses.rationale: Reports counts of deaths and positive tests factually: 'Twenty California condors... have died... half... tested positive'.
Reports frequency/commonality factually: 'the most common variety that occurs in Australia from time to time.'
Reports counts of farms factually: 'detected at two turkey farms and... detected at one emu farm'.
Reports count and types of birds factually: 'had 161 birds, including laying hens, ducks, geese, pigeons and peacocks'.
Reports counts of deaths by date factually: '16 laying hens had also died and... three geese, three peacocks and one duck had died too'.
Reports counts of deaths and suspected cases factually: 'at least 36 bald eagles have died... and eagles in two other states are suspected'.
Reports count of culled birds factually: 'culling of more than 23 million poultry'.
Reports count of culled birds and rate factually: 'culling of more than 23 million poultry... succumb at a high rate'.
Reports price change using standard verb: 'prices have been rising'.
Reports counts of farms/flocks factually: 'five other commercial farms are within the zone and 37 backyard flocks'.
Reports counts of killed birds factually: 'kill 33 million hens... and 9 million birds'.
Reports counts of states/locations factually: 'Cases have been reported in at least 12 states'.
Reports counts of flocks and killed birds factually: 'five additional flocks have been found... where more than 171,000 birds have been killed'.
Reports price changes using standard verbs and neutral adverb: 'prices rising rapidly... edged egg costs higher'.
Reports price change using standard verb phrase: 'are paying more'.
Reports price change using standard verb: 'raised my prices'.
Reports price change using standard verb phrase: 'have to pay more'.
Reports count of killed birds factually: 'More than 24 million chickens... have been killed'.
Reports count of laid off employees and destroyed birds factually: 'laid off more than 200 employees... destruction of 5.3 million laying hens'.
Reports counts of locations factually: 'reported in more than 230 counties in 37 states and at least six Canadian provinces'.
Reports count of infected species factually: 'at least 32 species of wild birds have been infected'.
Reports a trend/increase using standard verb: 'has increased in recent decades'.
Reports counts of infections and countries over time factually: 'caused 863 human infections in 18 countries since 2003'.
Reports count of fatal cases out of a total factually: 'Of those, 455 were fatal'.
Reports count of potentially infected workers factually: 'Four agricultural workers... may be infected'.
Reports count of cases and location factually: 'four cases emerged at a farm'.
Reports count of cases over time/location factually: 'there have been 27 human cases of bird flu reported in the United States'.
Reports potential future count factually: 'would bring that figure up to 31'.
Reports count of cases and status factually: 'five cases (four are confirmed, one is still considered presumptive)'.
Reports farm size/capacity factually: 'sometimes with millions of birds'.
Reports count of killed birds factually: 'seen only 5.1 million birds killed'.
Reports cases and locations using neutral adverb: 'sizeable bird flu cases confirmed on farms in Minnesota, Maryland, South Dakota, Wisconsin, Georgia and California'.
Reports cases, locations, and count of killed birds using neutral descriptors: 'sizeable bird flu cases confirmed... biggest one... where 198,200 birds were killed'.
Reports count of slaughtered birds over time factually: 'nearly 58 million birds were slaughtered as part of the outbreak'.
Reports count of cases and location factually: 'there are nine known human cases of H5N1 among poultry workers in Colorado'.
Reports count and locations factually: 'a handful of cases in other states including in Texas and in Michigan'.

Reports scale of impact and affected groups factually: 'impacted millions of animals with outbreaks in commercial poultry... backyard flocks, cows, wild birds, wild mammals and some cases among pets'.
Reports location/distance and species of confirmed cases factually: 'Cases have been confirmed 900 miles (1,500km) west... among southern fulmar'.
Reports counts of confirmed/suspected sites factually: 'confirmed bird flu deaths at eight sites... suspected... at 20 further sites'.
Reports counts/status of cases factually: 'a number of seabird cases have been confirmed, many... are still classed as suspected'.
Reports count of killed animals and location factually: 'killed an estimated 20,000 sea lions in Chile and Peru'.
Reports count of deaths factually: 'deaths of at least 25,000 turkeys'.
Reports count of killed birds and cost ($ metric) factually: 'killed 50 million birds... and cost... nearly $1 billion'.
Reports count and location factually: 'dozens tested positive along the U.S. East Coast'.
Reports percentage of production exported factually: 'Almost 18 percent of U.S. poultry production is exported'.
Reports market condition using standard verb: 'poultry supplies are down'.
Reports percentage changes using standard verb: 'supplies were down 14 percent... inventories were down 23 percent'.
Reports percentage factually: 'Almost 18 percent of U.S. poultry production is exported'.
Reports count and location factually: 'millions of fowl have been killed, many of them in Iowa'.
Reports market condition using standard verb: 'poultry market supplies have dropped'.
Reports percentage changes using standard verb: 'supplies were down 14 percent... inventories were down 23 percent'.
Reports count of birds and test result factually: 'a flock of about 240,000 chickens tested positive'.
Reports market condition using standard verb: 'poultry supplies are down'.
Reports percentage changes using standard verb: 'supplies were down 14 percent... inventories were down 23 percent'.
Reports count and timing/location factually: 'Dozens of wild birds have tested positive... including three in the Carolinas last month'.
Reports price index change using standard verbs and percentage: 'saw the largest increase... rising 12.2%'.
Reports count of farms and distance factually: 'Another 34 farms are situated within a 10-kilometer (6 mile) radius'.
Describes potential future price/availability changes using standard verbs: 'prices could rise and availability could drop'.
Reports counts of killed birds and scale of outbreaks factually: 'kill 33 million egg-laying hens... and 9 million birds... with smaller outbreaks'.
Reports forecast metric (tons) and total factually: 'forecast to export 3.4 million tons... of total global export of 13.4 million tons'.
Describes change using standard economic terms: 'growth in U.S. chicken meat export is partially due to the downturn in exports'.
Reports count of cases factually: 'lists three cases in commercial birds'.
Reports count of birds factually: 'among a flock of 240,000 birds was infected'.
Reports count of birds factually: 'in a commercial turkey flock of 30,000'.
Describes potential future impact on prices/exports using standard verbs: 'raising consumer prices and impacting exports'.
Reports cost ($ metric) factually: 'cost to the federal government was more than $1 billion $879 million... about $200 million'.
Reports count of birds factually: 'among a flock of 240,000 birds'.
Reports count of birds factually: 'among a flock of 240,000 in Kentucky'.
Reports count of cases over time/location factually: 'over 700 cases of bird flu in humans have been recorded globally since November 2003'.
